title: Brain Control of Bimanual Movement Enabled by Recurrent Neural Networks
description: Neural data from intracortical recordings in a human participant performing unimanual and bimanual tasks for BCI control using recurrent neural networks.
full_description: This dataset includes intracortical neural recordings from a participant with tetraplegia implanted with two 96-channel Utah arrays in the motor cortex. The participant performed unimanual and bimanual movements in instructed delay tasks and real-time brain-computer interface (BCI) control of two independent cursors. The goal was to decode bimanual control using recurrent neural network models.
citation: Deo D., Willett F., Avansino D., Hochberg L., Henderson J., Shenoy K. (2023). Brain control of bimanual movement enabled by recurrent neural networks. Scientific Reports. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-024-51617-3
